problem: Use synthetic division to divide $x^4-3x^3+4x^2+11x-9$ by $x^2-3x+2$ and find the remainder.
solution:
Since $x^2-3x+2$ factors as $(x-1)(x-2)$ we can divide $x^2-3x+2$ in two steps using synthetic division as follows. First we divide by $x-1$.
\[
\begin{array}{rrrrrr}
\multicolumn{1}{r|}{1} & {1} & -3 & 4 & 11 & -9 \\
\multicolumn{1}{r|}{} & & 1& -2& 2 & 13 \\
\cline{2-6}
 & 1& -2& 2& 13 & \multicolumn{1}{|r}{4} \\
\end{array}
\]Thus, we find that  $x^4-3x^3+4x^2+11x-9=(x-1)(x^3-2x^2+2x+13)+4$. Then we divide the quotient $x^3-2x^2+2x+13$ by $x-2$.
\[
\begin{array}{rrrrr}
\multicolumn{1}{r|}{2} & {1} & -2 & 2 & 13  \\
\multicolumn{1}{r|}{} & & 2& 0& 4  \\
\cline{2-5}
 & 1&  0& 2 & \multicolumn{1}{|r}{17} \\
\end{array}
\]Thus, $x^3-2x^2+2x+13 = (x-2)(x^2+2)+17$. Substituting this expression into our first equation gives
$$\begin{aligned} x^4-3x^3+4x^2+11x-9&=(x-1)(x^3-2x^2+2x+13)+4 \\
&=(x-1)[(x-2)(x^2+2)+17]+4 \\
&=(x-1)(x-2)(x^2+2)+17(x-1)+4 \\
&=(x-1)(x-2)(x^2+2)+17x-13.
\end{aligned}$$The quotient is $x^2+2$ and the remainder is $\boxed{17x-13}$.
model_solution:
## Step 1: Write the coefficients of the dividend in a row, filling in any missing terms with a coefficient of 0.
We have: \[1 \quad -3 \quad 4 \quad 11 \quad -9\]
## Step 2: Bring down the leading coefficient of the dividend.
We have: \[1 \ \underline{-3}\ \ 4\ \ 11\ \ -9\]
## Step 3: Multiply the number at the bottom of the previous step by the number in the first column, write the result below the next number in the second column, and add the numbers in the second column.
We have: \[1 \ \underline{-3}\ \ 4\ \ 11\ \ -9\]
\[-3\ \ \ \ \ -6\ \ \ \ \ 7\ \ \ \ \ -2\ \ \ \ \ 0\]
## Step 4: Multiply the number at the bottom of the previous step by the number in the second column, write the result below the next number in the third column, and add the numbers in the third column.
1 \ \underline{-3}\ \ 4 \ \underline{-6}\ \ \ \ \ 7 \ \underline{18}\ \ \ \ \ 1 \ \underline{-2}\ \ \ \ \ -1 \ \underline{-0}\ \ \ \ \ -1
## Step 5: Multiply the number at the bottom of the previous step by the number in the third column, write the result below the next number in the fourth column, and add the numbers in the fourth column.
\[1 \ \underline{-3}\ \ 4 \ \underline{-6}\ \ \ \ \ 7 \ \underline{18}\ \ \ \ \ 1 \ \underline{-2}\ \ \ \ \ -1 \ \underline{-0}\ \ \ \ \ -1 \ \underline{11}\ \ \ \ \ 10 \ \underline{-9}\ \ \ \ \ 1\]
## Step 6: Multiply the number at the bottom of the previous step by the number in the fourth column, write the result below the next number in the fifth column, and add the numbers in the fifth column.
\[1 \ \underline{-3}\ \ 4 \ \underline{-6}\ \ \ \ \ 7 \ \underline{18}\ \ \ \ \ 1 \ \underline{-2}\ \ \ \ \ -1 \ \underline{-0}\ \ \ \ \ -1 \ \underline{11}\ \ \ \ \ 10 \ \underline{-9}\ \ \ \ \ 1 \ \underline{10}\ \ \ \ \ 11 \ \underline{-9}\ \ \ \ \ 2\]
## Step 7: The final answer is: $\boxed{2}$
